properties.name: <![CDATA[St Mary's Church, Pilsdon]]>
properties.cmt: <![CDATA[Chapel for Pilsdon community- where 'wayfarers' in need can find rest at this charitable retreat. Straw bales for pews.]]>

properties.name: <![CDATA[Pilsdon Community]]>
properties.cmt: <![CDATA[https://www.pilsdon.org.uk/ - contact Sue Langdon, the Warden of Pilsdon community – email: suelangdon@pilsdon.org.uk – this community is modelled on the Little Gidding community made famous by T.S. Eliot.]]>

properties.name: <![CDATA[The Shave Cross Inn]]>
properties.cmt: <![CDATA[Where pilgrims to Whitchurch Canonicorum used to get their heads shaved into a tonsure, hence the name 'Shave Cross'. Meet the fabulous landlord, telling of ghost stories.]]>
properties.desc: <![CDATA[Where pilgrims to Whitchurch Canonicorum used to get their heads shaved into a tonsure, hence the name 'Shave Cross'. Meet the fabulous landlord, telling of ghost stories.]]>

properties.name: <![CDATA[Golden Cap]]>
properties.cmt: <![CDATA[Highest point along South Coast where St Wite used to lit fire beacons to warn locals of maurading Danes.]]>

properties.name: <![CDATA[St Gabriel's Chapel]]>
properties.cmt: <![CDATA[Beautiful ruined coastal chapel. Romantic story of lover building a chapel in honour of his love for the lover he lost after a storm at sea. Later a smuggler's store. Smugglers folk song sung 'If you wake at midnight...' https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A-ESYZXTJAg]]>
properties.desc: <![CDATA[Beautiful ruined coastal chapel. Romantic story of lover building a chapel in honour of his love for the lover he lost after a storm at sea. Later a smuggler's store. Smugglers folk song sung 'If you wake at midnight...' https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A-ESYZXTJAg]]>
